meetings.title: January
speaker: Jenny Crusie
meetings.time: Business meeting at 12:30 pm, Speaker at 1:30 pm
meetings.topic:
Motif and Metaphor

Guest speaker Jenny Crusie will discuss motif and metaphor in fiction. Motif and metaphor are ways to deepen your story’s meaning without putting that meaning blatantly on the page. Through careful analysis of your completed first draft, you can find the things that you unconsciously put into your story and enhance them to create the kind of emotional subtext that draws a reader in without hitting her over the head with MEANING.

meetings.title: February
speaker: Donna MacMeans
meetings.time: Networking at 12:00 pm, Business meeting at 12:30 pm, Speaker at 1:30 pm
meetings.topic:
The Other HEA: Grab Your Readers with Emotional Attachment

In order for a reader to care about a story, they must care about the characters. Learn how employing rooting interests in your stories that will create an emotional attachment-- without the reader ever realizing how you manipulated their emotions.

meetings.title: March
speaker: Nikki Sloane
meetings.time: Networking at 12:00 pm, Business meeting at 12:30 pm, Speaker at 1:30 pm
meetings.topic:
Slay Your Promos
Is your book the complete package? Join Nikki as she talks about nailing all the elements that will help capture new readers. She’ll discuss craft, release approach, and promotion/ad strategies.

meetings.title: April
speaker: Kate McMurray
meetings.time: Networking at 12:00 pm, Business meeting at 12:30 pm, Speaker at 1:30 pm
meetings.topic:
Better, stronger, faster first drafts.

Writing a good first draft in less time is not so much a matter of typing faster but rather of using your time more efficiently. If you know where you’re going before you start your journey, you’ll get there faster.

meetings.title: May
speaker: Liz Pelletier
meetings.time: Networking at 12:00 pm, Business meeting at 12:30 pm, Speaker at 1:30 pm
meetings.topic:
Growth Hacking a Bestseller

Join publisher and editor Liz Pelletier as she demonstrates a new and innovative way to develop, write, edit, and market a book with the greatest chance of making your next release a best seller.

meetings.title: June
speaker: Gwen Henandez
meetings.time: Networking at 12:00 pm, Business meeting at 12:30 pm, Speaker at 1:30 pm
meetings.location: Zoom meeting and The Forge Tavern 1375 Bethel Road, Columbus, OH 43220
meetings.topic:
Scrivener Lessons
Scrivener is excellent writing software for both plotters and pantsers. Want to find out what makes it so popular, or learn some new tricks? The author of Scrivener For Dummies will walk you through the basics and cover some of her favorite features.

meetings.title: July
speaker: Beth Barany
meetings.time: Networking at 12:00 pm, Business meeting at 12:30 pm, Speaker at 1:30 pm
meetings.location: Zoom meeting and The Forge Tavern 1375 Bethel Road, Columbus, OH 43220
meetings.topic:
NLP and Writing Great Novels
NLP, or neurolinguistic programming, is a tool that helps you write more, better, and faster. Used with respect and compassion, NLP is a gentle way to help you have what you want without having to “work” to be different than who you are.

meetings.title: August
speaker: Jordyn Blanson
meetings.time: Networking at 12:00 pm, Business meeting at 12:30 pm, Speaker at 1:30 pm
meetings.location: Zoom meeting and The Forge Tavern 1375 Bethel Road, Columbus, OH 43220
meetings.topic:
The Case for Diversity and Inclusion
This is a workshop that focuses on understanding what Diversity and inclusion really is, how it affects each and every one of us, and focuses on examining the way that we think about the world we live in.

meetings.title: September
speaker: Juliette Hyland
meetings.time: Networking at 12:00 pm, Business meeting at 12:30 pm, Speaker at 1:30 pm
meetings.location: Zoom meeting and The Forge Tavern 1375 Bethel Road, Columbus, OH 43220
meetings.topic:
Trope Your Way to a First Draft
In genre fiction tropes are marketing devices. Everyone has their favorite! But as writers you can use these tropes to build your characters, and conflicts - basically your first draft!

meetings.title: October
speaker: Jeffe Kennedy
meetings.time: Networking at 12:00 pm, Business meeting at 12:30 pm, Speaker at 1:30 pm
meetings.location: Zoom meeting and The Forge Tavern 1375 Bethel Road, Columbus, OH 43220
meetings.topic: Sexual Tension – Getting Away from Wham, Bam, Thank you, Ma’am

meetings.title: November
